page.title: 14Anglican minister cont
page.content: {Q. Is the church a tourist attraction? A. Yes. It is built on a very ancient site where it is said St. Paulinus baptised the first Christians in the year 627 in the beck. Later, a wooden church may have been built, and then a stone church. The present building is post Norman. It's a major building, one of the larger churches in this part of Yorkshire. {Q. Can you tell me something about the {Church Restoration Appeal?} A. The shell of the church building is in a very poor state and is deteriorating all the time. We've got three leaks in the roof, repairs will cost about Â£20,000. The stonework is weathering very badly and in some places it's just crumbling away. The Appeal Committee under the direction of Mr. Sands organises fund raising for the appeal.
